channel.title: Server status?
channel.description: Ok i need the code for a server status checker on my page so every one will stop bugging me about when the server is going to be up cand someone please help?

item.title: Server status?
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

[quote=“Goodoo dolls, post:7, topic:168616”][quote author=error.login link=topic=228222.msg1961460#msg1961460 date=1198972597]

omg ive been looking for this for 3 years ty ill see if it works

How?

i think he is a little be retarted.
[/quote]

i am not retarted ive just recently join these forums after my friend stoped rs ps thats where i learned stuff from him and i was looking on html sites for this code and yet it doesnt work[/quote]Lmao, dude this is PHP. HTML sucks pretty much… lol. And you can find it by studying PHP at: http://www.php.net/manual/en/

Read full topic

item.title: Server status?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Goodoo dolls:

omg ive been looking for this for 3 years ty ill see if it works o ya wut is the $ERRNO, $ERRSTR, thing??

I believe they are variables that, if an error occurs, that the error data is read into.

[quote=“Goodoo dolls, post:3, topic:168616”]is just says BloodScape V2 is:

help??[/quote]

Are you running it on your web host or just your local machine? It needs to be requested from a PHP enabled server for the PHP to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Server status?
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

Here-

[code]

Server Status YOUSERVERNAME is: <?php $checkCHAR = @fsockopen(YOURSERVERIP, YOURSERVERPORT, $ERRNO, $ERRSTR, 1); if($checkCHAR) { echo('ONLINE'); } else { echo('OFFLINE!'); ?> [/code] [b]I'm pretty sure thats how it goes...[/b]

Read full topic
